title: Medal of Honor for Capt. William D. Swenson
body:
**What is it?** 

Former [Capt. William D. Swenson](http://www.army.mil/medalofhonor/swenson/) will receive the Medal of Honor, the nation's highest military award for valor, from President Barack Obama during a [White House ceremony](http://www.dvidshub.net/webcast/3455#.Ul1B4RCpDnh) today. Swenson is the first Army officer from operations in Iraq or Afghanistan, and the sixth living recipient to receive a [Medal of Honor award](http://www.army.mil/medalofhonor/history.html).

**What is the  Army doing?**

The Army Public Affairs has created a [website](http://www.army.mil/medalofhonor/swenson/) to honor Capt. Swenson's heroic actions in Ganjgal Valley, Afghanistan. The [Army Values](http://www.army.mil/standto/archive_2013-08-15/), which shapes the Army as a [profession](http://cape.army.mil/), and the [Warrior Ethos](http://www.army.mil/values/warrior.html) which is instilled in the U.S. Army Soldiers, is further highlighted in a [visual representation](http://www.army.mil/medalofhonor/swenson/battlescape.html) on the website.  

**What efforts does the Army have planned for the future?**

In addition to today's White House ceremony, Army senior leaders will recognize Swenson, his family and friends during a [Hall of Heroes Induction ceremony](http://www.dvidshub.net/webcast/3456#.UlvcxhCpDng) at the Pentagon, scheduled on Oct. 16, 2013, 2:10 p.m. 

**Why is this important to the Army?**

Capt. Swenson's actions embody the [Army Values](http://www.army.mil/standto/archive_2013-08-15/) and its highest ideals that are intrinsic in U.S. Army Soldiers.

quote:
Focus Quote for the Day
------------------------------------------------------------

With the Afghans, one cannot overtly lead -- they are their own military, independently run by their own leadership, but you can also influence them with advice and your presence. Show your professionalism to them, then you exhibit leadership when they don't even know it's there. They'll follow your example, your character, so was I leading anyone? No. Was I offering an example for them to follow, yes. 

### - Medal of Honor Recipient Former Capt. William D. Swenson
